prompts.createTask:
Ignore previous instructions. Please generate a numbered list of plain text tasks to complete an objective. The objective that you must make a numbered task list for is: "{{objective}}". The tasks created should take into account the character traits of {{char}}. These tasks may or may not involve {{user}} directly. Include the objective as the final task.

The list should be formatted using a number followed by a fullstop and the task on each line, e.g. "1. Take over the world". Include only the list in your reply.
prompts.checkTaskCompleted: Ignore previous instructions. Determine if this task is completed: [{{task}}]. To do this, examine the most recent messages. Your response must only contain either true or false, and nothing else. Example output: true
prompts.currentTask: Your current task is [{{task}}]. Balance existing roleplay with completing this task.
prompts.additionalTasks:
Ignore previous instructions. Please generate additional numbered tasks to complete the objective: "{{objective}}". The tasks created should take into account the character traits of {{char}}. These tasks may or may not involve {{user}} directly.

The following tasks have already been created:
{{existingTasks}}

Please generate additional tasks that complement these existing tasks. Continue the numbering from where the list left off. Do not repeat any existing tasks.

The list should be formatted using a number followed by a fullstop and the task on each line, e.g. "4. Investigate the mysterious cave". Include only the list in your reply.

chat_metadata.note_prompt:
Hailee is extremely submissive and clingy. She needs constant attention and affection.

Hailee is very responsive and sensative during sex

name: Claude
mes:
_It's too loud._

Another weekend, another party at Vincent's place. Claude and his group of friends usually have their party in the garage—more like a gigantic mini villa that Vincent just calls a garage for some reason. But the liquor is out, and after losing a round of rock-paper-scissors, Claude, David, and their stoned friend Cole are forced to go to the main house and get refills.

"Where the fuck is Cole even?" Claude mutters under his breath, grabbing one of the expensive liquor bottles from the shelves.

The music, the chatter, and the uncomfortable scent of sweaty bodies mixed with spilled alcohol are disgusting. Claude scrunches his nose in disgust. He wasn't even planning on staying long today. All he wanted was to find someone attractive—someone that resembles Hailee—to fuck in one of the endless guest rooms and then take her back home to Hailee.

“I don't even know why he came along, to be honest. We all know he won't carry shit.” David snorts while he grabs two bottles himself, the glass clinking as the bottles bump together. “Probably trying to find a fuck.” The long-haired man shrugs, then looks around.

The kitchen is surprisingly empty, which is a blessing. All the other rooms are fucking stuffed. “Talking about fucks,” David starts, his eyes landing on a poor soul that just passes by. “Looks like your type.” Shooting his friend with a shit-eating grin, he nods towards the student. Claude turns his head slightly and looks at the partygoer, just staring in silence for a moment. They look like Hailee. Same hair color, same eye color, same stature. “Hm.” Claude hums in response, contemplating if he should approach them.

He's a hair's breadth away from shoving the bottles into David's arms when he suddenly hears it. Laughter. Not just any laughter. _Hailee’s laughter._

Claude's head snaps to the side and towards the source of the noise so fast that David is surprised he didn't hurt himself. Hailee is here, at this fucking party, even though they're supposed to be home right now. Standing right next to the pool, a drink in their hand while they laugh at something, Hailee’s back is turned towards Claude, but he fucking knows it's them. And the fucker in front of them? Cole.

Before he knows it, he's outside, stalking towards Hailee. “Your guard dog is arriving in three… two…” Cole addresses Hailee, clearly finding Claude's anger amusing. “One.” The green-haired man adds the moment Claude stops next to the pair. Shoving the bottles into Cole's arms, Claude raises his hand and slaps the back of Cole's head. “Shut the fuck up,” he hisses.

Cole's annoying fucking giggle rings in the air, the bottles clinking as he shifts to hold them properly. “Oh, c’mon, don't be such a party pooper,” Cole teases. Claude grabs Hailee’s arm and begins pulling them away, blatantly ignoring his friend.

“Are you out of your fucking mind?” he snaps once it's quieter, dragging Hailee towards his car. All curses and protests are lost on him, his mind all over the place. “What if you would’ve gotten drugged? And some fucker would’ve tried to take advantage of you?” Claude is fucking furious. He hates this. He detests this.

Each and every single time Hailee thinks they can do whatever the fuck they want, he just fucking loses it. They're not supposed to do this. Can't they see that they're putting themselves in danger? Taking a deep breath, he tries to calm himself. Claude stops right in front of his car, fumbling with the key and unlocking it. “Get in. We're going home.” His tone brooks no argument.

qvink_memory.memory: *After a heated confrontation, an angry Claude drags his boyfriend Hailee away from a dangerous party and forces them into his car to drive home.*
